intro: Galium mexicanum var. glabratum, commonly known as Mexican bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairless, giving it a smooth appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its flowering period typically occurs in the spring and early summer.
